name: Panzermadels: Tank Dating Simulator
description: Panzermadels! The first dating simulator to deliver a thoughtful look at tanks, and the men who date them!
minimum_requirements: OS: Microsoft Windows Vista Processor: 1.5 Ghz Processor Memory: 4 GB RAM Graphics: Integrated Graphics Chip Storage: 2 GB available space Additional Notes: If your PC can't run this how are you running Steam?
recommended_requirements: OS: Microsoft Windows 7 Processor: Anything better than a 1.5Ghz Processor Memory: 8 GB RAM Graphics: Integrated Graphics Chip Storage: 4 GB available space

reviews.review_text: This game gives you the choice of riding a variety of tanks. You have to choose your tank wisely, as each one has their strengths and weaknesses depending on the terrain and situation.   For example, the M4 is a very versatile medium tank with a 75mm gun, and although it's armour isn't particularly strong, a skilled commander can utilize it's sloped surfaces and rounded turret for maximum effect. Meanwhile, the T34 has great sloped armour and wide tracks for effective traverse in rough terrain, but lacks the more sophisticated equipment and reliability of the Pz.IV. Of course, choosing the legendary Tiger I might be tempting with it's great 88mm and thick front armour, but you have to be mindful of it's unreliable engine.  I have to admit though, that the selection of tanks could, and should have been greater. There are several other NPC tanks that you will meet through the game, like the Maus and the B1, but unfortunately you don't get to drive them. The areas in the game are also not as varied as they could have been, but includes a beach, a mountain and several urban areas.  However, despite it's shortcomings, this is a very charming tank simulator.
This game is the best game since Hatoful Boyfriend. Also, this is the best way to disappoint your parents.      Now, if you want boats... KanColle is your answer.
My former friend bought me this game and I got my ♥♥♥♥ sucked by two different tanks before being court-martialed and executed. 8/10

You can date tanks in this weird dating simulator, it a mix of the plot from Sakura games where most of the girls like you for completly odd reasons, looking at you Tiger I, but on the other hand you can date a small range of the main battle tanks from WWII, which are, in order of meeting: M4 Sherman, T-34, Panzer IV, Tiger I and IS-2. Other tanks are introduced as the game 'progresses', depending on how fast you hit the spacebar, which are: Char-B1, Type 3 Chu No, Polish 7-TP, Bob, and Maus. The size of the tank, for example, The Tiger I Super Heavy Tank and the Panzer VIII Maus Super Heavy Tank are judged by the size of the 'Ammunition Racks' basically thier chest size, while the Char B1 is smaller. There are some tank jokes in there for the people that know about that stuff, 'Whats happening with this girl crying?', 'Oh Tiger I breaks down alot, its a design flaw' which mock the tanks designs.  Id give this game a 10/10 for the sole reason of being able to somehow illustrate a Tiger I Super Heavy Tank in human form so you can date it.
Tanks/10  Also the ending was more rushed than a Liam Neeson movie.

In Panzermadels you play as a guy named Erwin, who is enlisted into tank school. You must search around trying to find the place, but when you do find the place things aren’t as you imagined. From there the game turns wild. The developer supplied a review copy for me.  I spent around 3 hours playing the game. There are 5 romance routes, but depending on your choice early then you may have an early ending. Each playthrough takes around 2 hours-2 hours 30 mins. I don't want to talk too deeply about the story but it's pretty wacky (in a bizarre sense) and there were always new surprises around each corner.   Positives  Choices – A lot of VN’s miss out on this part, they forget to let the reader have choices and gladly this game has an array of choices to choose from. Music – The music is well chosen and goes well with the game. Pretty creative and confusing – The game is highly creative, somehow associating vehicles with humans and managing to combine them.  Funny and didnt stop suprising me – Right from the start the ‘wackiness’ of the game had me laughing, especially the crazy drill sergeant. The game didn’t stop surprising me and the scenarios I encountered kept me laughing for a while. Art style is pretty good considering it's an indie game – Most indie VN’s I have played have had a more rougher art style but this game has pretty nice art and an abundance of backdrops keeping the game fresh. “Ammo Racks, Armored Plating and Amphibious attachments” – The game is completely riddled with Innuendos and most of the times I could not help but facepalm and laugh at what I was reading.   Negatives  Spelling errors – At the beginning there were a few spelling errors but nothing that major.  Only 5 save slots – This limits you to how many saves you can have. This can be a minor for most who love to save often. story crossing – This may be wrong but t34 give me number on hill then next day in class she had to give me her number again apparently and was reluctant about it. Lack of audio options and customisation – There are no real settings in options like audio sliders or font text.    Overall, I had a lot of fun with this game. Mostly due to the innuendos and randomness that the game is. It made me laugh quite often and I could easily recommend it to gamers who are looking for a game which is a bit more extraordinaire and bizarre. The price is a tad high but if you feel it’s not that much of a dent on your wallet then go for it.   The only qualm I have with this game is that sometimes I felt like my choices were not really remembered at all. I did have a fun time though and again, this was a real funny game.

Experience a game that will make you feel shame upon launching it. A game with awe-inspiring design, a game with a plot so strange that you will give up on trying to decipher it and just roll with the flow, a game with communist tanks who look like girls. Bear witness to nazi tank occult rituals, a haphazard ending, historically comic writing and much, much more.   You are Erwin Lemmor, a student who just started going to tank school. Imagine his surprise as all the tanks are actually girls! The teacher is a perverted and angry drillsergeant, who teaches Erwin right from wrong in this strange and surreal world.  I don't think I would have played this if it hadn't been gifted to me.
I shunned all the slav tanks, ♥♥♥♥ed a Panzer IV and went to prison. 10/10, my entire life has led up to this.
This game has the following: -Comedy -Royalty Free Ukulele -Anime -Tanks Oh and also, you can actually, physically, ♥♥♥♥ a tank. 10/10, I do recommend this.
If I ever need that EXTRA little smidge of courage to drop the toaster in the bathtub, I'll fire this one up again.

Was this a good game? Panzer Madels is an average dating sim, the ending is a bit too quick and ruins the story, but, the humor, the chracters and the story (Minus the ending) are well done, and as a WW2 buff, had me smiling a few times, at a cute moment and jokes. It's worth it if you have the money, but i wouldn't sell everything for it. But if you have the cash, buy the game and gain some smiles:)

In a world where HEAT shells reigned supreme, a man playing World of Tanks gets one ♥♥♥♥ed by artillery for n-th time and decides to do madlibs on the toilet while taking a dump using only tank related words. The result is Panzermadels.   What you get for $10 is roughly 2 hours of hilarious tank related puns, dark inappropriate jokes (RIP Poland), and tasteless historical references. Not mention WoT players can get handy insights as to where to penetrate tanks such as the Panzer IV and the T34, as well as the ammo rack locations of the Maus and the TOG II. I probably gained about 400 WN8 after finishing Panzermadels, but I dunno for sure since Im a red.  Buy it, love it. and damn...the ammo racks on the TOG be huge!

Well this certainly is a game that exists. It's quite silly and shouldn't be taken seriously. There seems to be inspiration from Kancolle and Girls und Panzer as well, with the mention of tankery. I think this game is an in between for me, I like it but I feel there is a lot to be worked on or just plain missing. The options menu is pretty lacking, only featuring an option to hide the message or skip. I would have liked to see a text speed option. A severe lack of music, a lot of the game didn't even have a soundtrack in the background, only some parts of the game did. Not that great of writing, seeing the characters start their sentences multiple times with 'haha,' was just kind of weird. While that is something you see in text conversations, it's not really something that belongs when characters are talking face to face. There is also no gallery where you can view the CG's after you get them, which I feel is a big feature of VN's and it's not good that it isn't there. Personally I was expecting something a bit more in depth. Perhaps that is my own fault, but after playing other VN's that are silly, such as Hatoful Boyfriend, I feel that this VN is lacking and needed a bit more work. For what it is I also feel that the price is a bit much. $5 would be more reasonable for this game.  All in all, the game is silly and has plenty of history jokes, but it lacks in actual depth and never seems to tred beyond its silliness into something that is actually enjoyable and not boring after a while. I was actually excited for this when I heard of it. I love tanks and anything WW2 related but I also enjoy VN's. So to be a bit disappointed by it is a bit of a shame. For the person who just wants a good laugh this might work, but if you're coming for something that actually stays interesting then I'd look somewhere else.

I can't really explain this game just like most other dating simulators on Steam. It is a rather interesting concept that Amercian developer DEVGRU-P had added to the proliferating genre. I'm not going to be bias in the review, but I'm going to list the gameplay and mechanics of the game.   The Good :  + There are usually chocies you can make during dialouge which affects what happens next. + Quirky characters with well-written dialouge.
